perturbation.original_text: Fleet will at all times ensure that the Columbia Equipment meets and is operated and maintained in accordance with Applicable Laws and cGMP and GDP.
perturbation.changed_text: Fleet will endeavor to ensure that the Columbia Equipment meets and is operated and maintained in accordance with Applicable Laws and cGMP and GDP.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'ensure' to 'endeavor to ensure' weakens the obligation to comply with Applicable Laws, cGMP (current Good Manufacturing Practice), and GDP (Good Distribution Practice). This introduces ambiguity regarding the level of compliance required. It is no longer a strict obligation but a goal to be pursued with effort.
perturbation.contradicted_law: EU guidelines for current Good Distribution Practice guidelines 2013/C 343/01 as amended

perturbation.original_text: Fleet shall keep the Columbia Equipment safe and in good working order and shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that the Columbia Equipment does not become contaminated or corroded.
perturbation.changed_text: Fleet should attempt to keep the Columbia Equipment in generally acceptable condition and may consider steps to reduce contamination or corrosion.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'shall keep' with 'should attempt to keep' and 'all reasonable steps to ensure' with 'may consider steps to reduce' significantly diminishes the responsibility to maintain the Columbia Equipment's condition, allowing for potential negligence and non-compliance. The original section clearly outlines a duty of care for Columbia's equipment. The modified version only suggests an intention to do the same.
perturbation.contradicted_law: EU guidelines for current Good Manufacturing Practice

perturbation.original_text: Each party agrees that it shall not export, directly or indirectly, any technical information acquired from the other party under this Agreement or any products using such technical information to a location or in a manner that at the time of export requires an export licence or other governmental approval, without first obtaining the written consent to do so from the appropriate agency or other governmental entity.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party will try to avoid exporting, directly or indirectly, any technical information acquired from the other party under this Agreement or any products using such technical information to a location or in a manner that at the time of export requires an export licence or other governmental approval, and will seek written consent from the relevant agency if feasible.
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'agrees that it shall not export... without first obtaining written consent' to 'will try to avoid exporting...and will seek written consent...if feasible' transforms a strict prohibition into a weaker, discretionary obligation. The original text mandates obtaining export licenses; the modification suggests merely attempting to do so, potentially violating export control regulations. It changes a clear commitment to a vague aspiration.
perturbation.contradicted_law: US Export Administration Act of 1979 (50 App. U.S.C. ยง2401 et. seq.)
